titleStmt.title: Thomas Arnett to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7444

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlette
Gov of Kentucky

Your petitoner stats that he is an orphan boy, a citizen of Magoffin County and is very poor and has no estate and was fined, by the present term Circuit Court of this County Sixty Dollars for tipling under the following Circumstances, there was a negro man who was a slave of Reuben Arnett went to a house raising in Company with your petitioner and the said negro man had some whisky which he sold at the said house raising -- and as the said negro sold the whisky and your petitioner being in Company with him he was fined, this is the Substance of the proof in the case

Yours Respectfully
Thomas Whitely
Thomas Arnett
I am satisfied that the facts above are correctly stated & join in the petition

Magoffin Cir Ct
vs
Thomas Arnett,
to } Pet from
Magoffin for Remission of fine of Sixty Dollars,
Remitted 13 Dec /65
